Reviews.Title: “You can find a better hotel.”
Reviews.Author: noelle75
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a wonderful location on the Marmara sea. Using the back entrance, you can be in Sultanahmet in less than 10 minutes by walking. The front reception staff are wonderful, friendly and helpful. Here are the negatives, and there are too many for a hotel that calls itself a four star hotel. The walls and windows are paper thin. You can hear everything and I mean everything from outside, from the room beside you and the room above you. The restaurant is mediocre and so very overpriced. There are very few amenities; just soap and shampoo in the bathroom; no gym or spa, breakfast is 14EUR and was not included in the rate. There are so many other hotels in the same area, it is worth looking elsewhere. I recommend the Maywood Hotel in Istanbul. I won't stay at the Kalyon again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel with nice view of the sea”
Reviews.Author: Sachinidou_K
Reviews.Content: The staff is very kind.Great variety of the breakfast.The food was great too.The hotel is located at a very nice place with a view to marmara sea and it is very close to the ancient center.I recommend this hotel to you.Sachinidou Kalliopi from Greece.

Reviews.Title: “Style”
Reviews.Author: KlasieRiyadh
Reviews.Content: Beautifull hotel situated on the Bospherous level with remains of the old city wall just there. Within walking distance of the Galata bridge and all the important sights in Sultanahmet area. Enjoyed our stay. Very helpfull staff!! Thought that the organised meal at the fish restaurant was a rip-off!.......but it was our choice, so.......

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Viviane H
Reviews.Content: The Kalyon hotel is in a great location to explore the old town of Istanbul. Most sights and main places of interest are within walking distance. The hotel is surrounded by nice places to eat and rooftop restaurants with unbeatable views. A variety of quality shops are just around the corner. The hotel provides excellent service and the rooms are comfortable. Of course you should try to book a room with sea view if possible.

Reviews.Title: “High quality hotel on the seaside of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: RotterdamHans
Reviews.Content: The Kalyon is one of the best hotels in Sultanahmet, modern with a touch of class. Rooms are not very spacious but big enoigh and with all amenities, some are newly renovated. The all face the sea. Service is excellent and breakfast is fine. The hotel is at close walking distance of the Blue Mosque / Hagia Sofia area. There is a busy road between the hotel and the seaside but it doesn't cause much disturbance.Prices are a bit steep and who is looking for a cheap clean hotel in the area, will find many options. But for who will pay a bit more the Kalyon is certainly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent localization! Good service!”
Reviews.Author: Ana_Sofia_Silva
Reviews.Content: Very near the old city center, excellent choice price/quality. Choose a room with view to the sea otherwise you will wake up with the first prayers at 7 in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: The staff were very good. The location is very close to the historical placese and in front of the sea view. The rooms were nice and there was free Wifi in the hotel. The breakfast is average with limited options but has all the main stapels and was very enjoyable, plus the service is superb. Expensive restaurant, so would really suggest to eat and drink elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Winter visit”
Reviews.Author: Lesley Abdela A
Reviews.Content: In future please address your e-mails equally to women and men. It is very old fashioned to write 'Dear Sirs' as you have done in this request for feed-back. I am a woman. The panoramic view from my bedroom window of the Marmara sea was the best feature of staying at the Hotel. Thestaff were helpful and courteous. It was winter and the bar was gloomy - how about a wood-fire in the bar to make it feel more cheerful in winter? My work colleague and I enjoyed strolling in the evenings up through the picturesque streets in the Sultanahmet district.

Reviews.Title: “amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Pascale K
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful staff, clean, spacious, comfortable & quiet room, excellent breakfast, lovely location. Real value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Just great”
Reviews.Author: amin n
Reviews.Content: Take a look at the photo I uploaded. No need to say much! I had a 3 night stay at Kalyon hotel. My room had a sea-view. Through the big wall-size window I had a unique view of the marmar sea. The reflection of sun rays on the sea was just wonderful. I used to sit in the sun in my room looking at the sea for hours. The room was clean. The reception staff were really very very helpful and very friendly. I could easily exchange money in euro with an exchange rate better than the airport. The location of the hotel is really really close to the blue mosque and it was even closer to a sema dance place. I had a nice breakfast. I strongly recommend everyone to try its restaurant. I had a dinner once. The food quality was just great and the price was very reasonable considering the quality. I had no problem using the wireless internet and the speed was good. For sure this hotel will be the only place I consider in my next stay in Istanbul and I have already recommended it to all my friends who might travel to Turkey at some point.

Reviews.Title: “very satisfied, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: steppenw0lfe
Reviews.Content: I booked on the same day I arrived, and paid 70 plus euros. For this amount, the hotel was extremely good value for money. The location is super, with many restaurants and cafes not far from the hotel, and rooms overlooking the sea. The service was wonderful, everyone at reception tries so hard to accommodate our wishes. The single rooms are obviously small but with all the availabilities of a good hotel - minibar, free tea and coffee, notepad etc. Reception and lobby are huge for Istanbul hotels. Enjoyed my stay here alot and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific views of the Marmara Sea, just a few blocks from Hagia Sofia”
Reviews.Author: Reamor
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights and were upgraded to a Premier class room when we pointed out that the listed amenities for our standard room included a tub, but the standard room had only a shower. While both rooms had great views, the Premier class had much newer and classier furnishings. Breakfast was included; a good buffet among the better we had on our three week trip. It is just a couple of blocks down hill from the much pricier Sultanahmet tourist haunts. We had rolling luggage and the extra blocks were more than worth the savings we achieved. There is an entrance on the back side of the hotel (it faces the Marmara Sea and the road that runs along the shore). Free internet. And kiosks on the street leading to the back door sell diet Coke for 2 TD, less than we found it at other places nearby. We consider it an excellent choice for the money, with the three night stay in early Nov. (still high season) we likely saved around $100/night over other hotels we considered. The hotel restaurant also served a very respectable dinner, with a 15% discount to guests. I strongly recommend considering this as an option if you want to stay in Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Kylie B
Reviews.Content: Superb location and outstanding staff. Walking distance to the Sultanahmet Mosque, Ayasofya, Topkapi Palace, just take the little exit in the back. Everyone from the front desk to the restaurant staff were hospitable, helpful and friendly; they really made our stay enjoyable. We had a quiet room with a view of the Sea of Marmara; upgraded for free from a Superior to Executive room. Very nice and clean and included a desk and seating area. Delicious breakfast buffet!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Istanbul. Next to the sea and almost next to the main attractions.”
Reviews.Author: AngelosX
Reviews.Content: Yes, yes, and yes. The right hotel in the right place. I've born in Istanbul and spend 13 years there, so I know the place in first hand. Everything you need is so close. Attractions, shopping, transportation, everything. Not to mention the luxury, and above all the hospitality of the staff. We spent one week in this hotel and it was just like home. Better than home for my wife who didn't have to cook! Even the restaurant has a fantastic - among others - local cuisine.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle”
Reviews.Author: LizandRick
Reviews.Content: Yes, this hotel is right in the middle of everything. I would recommend it to anyone who does not want a big fancy hotel that costs big bucks. This hotel was clean and nicely decorated. The best part is you are in walking distance to every attraction in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “I can reccomend it”
Reviews.Author: livio b
Reviews.Content: the location is superb and very convenient to historical sites the stuff at the reception are very professional, apart from a little mishap with the computer, the place is very modern, clean and secure; sadly the service at the restaurant is very slow, but all in all that is not very important. To conclude: if I come back to Istanbul I am going to choose the Kalyon again and I will recommend it too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Friendly Staff & welcoming home ambiance in the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MarianneKareem
Reviews.Content: We were extremely lucky to stay at the Kalyon Hotel. The staff across the board are extremely friendly and smiling to all the guests. The location is perfect as it is in the vicinity of all the happenings and away from the regular Istanbul Traffic jams. The rooms were comfortable and waking up in to morning to the view on the Sea of Marmara is awesome. Thank you Kalyon Hotel for making our first trip to Istanbul a memorable trip. We are definitely going back to Kalyon Hotel once back to Istanbul. Marianne & Kareem

Reviews.Title: “Romantic morning at Kalyon Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OlgaDorofeeva
Reviews.Content: Very close to the main historical places to visit. You pass through secret back door and find yourself at the quite and old street leading you just to the historical center. Beautiful open-air terrasse for breakfast with a view of Bosforus. Champagne and hot croissans served for breakfast. Modern suites with Wi Fi, LCD and working place. Everything you need for business or romantic trip. Me and my husband have a short but really pleasant stay at Kalion Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good staff, mediocre hotel”
Reviews.Author: pob74
Reviews.Content: Lovely communal areas, fairly good location for the old town, and very attentive staff. However, the small bedroom I was allocated, although spotlessly clean, really wasn't great. The biggest problem I found was the antiquated "air conditioning". Rather than cooling the room down it just seemed to move the hot, humid air around and had fan settings but no temperature settings. Given the heat of the Istanbul summer, not having decent air conditioning in the bedrooms of a modern hotel is a major failing. I also struggled with the temperamental room safe and the TV had poor reception with, strangely, no international news channel. The free wi-fi for guests is a nice touch, though painfully slow, and the restaurant is pleasant but serves very average food. There is nothing terrible about the Kalyon and the service is spot on, but I won't be rushing back - and certainly never again in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “it was a memorable experience”
Reviews.Author: georgiaspiropoulou
Reviews.Content: 5 unforgettable days in a fabulous hotel with a fantastic view to the sea ,perfect service and excellent staff! Breakfast and dinner were delicious and prices reasonable. Rooms were cleaned daily we had free cofee and tea in the room,free internet and it was 5 minutes walk to the famous sights!!!!! We would glady stay at your hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVED IT AND WE'LL BE BACK !”
Reviews.Author: ANDREAS I
Reviews.Content: My overall rating for all the services we experienced at Kalyon Hotel during our 7-nights stay is EXCELLENT !! and of course we will not hesitate to recommend it to any of our friends might be interested to visit ISTANBUL. Needless to say that we will you will definitely hear from us again whenever we decide to repeat our visit to ISTANBUL. My wholehearted congratulations to each member of your staff.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, friendly, quiet & beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: TurkeyFan043
Reviews.Content: Imagine being in a guest room overlooking the sea, sheltered by ruins of the 21-mile ancient Istanbul city walls with the gorgeous star and crescent Turkish flag flying above it all. This was our room, and not only was the view beautiful, but the bed luxurious, and the room quiet and comfortable. The Kalyon's design is elegant and understated, refreshingly so--definitely not a clone of increasingly look-alike hotels. Their breakfast on the terrance was an extra cost, but a bounteous spread of fresh fruits, a variety of breads, pastries and jams, and eggs and bacon. Best of all for me though were the customer-service staff who were welcoming, friendly and patiently helped me with lost luggage, finding new clothes, and maneuvering around Istanbul. Fabulous! Bill Cole, Colrain, MA, USA

Reviews.Title: “A Superb hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Rosie2410
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times over the years. The rooms are very spacious, the staff are wonderful and the breakfasts are *amazing*. Yes, it is on a main road, but I think the sea views more than make up for it. It is a short walk by the Hippodrome to Sultenamet to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. Due to personal reasons, after many years of travel to Turkey, I have not been back to you since 2005 (couldn't put the date back that far...); my partner with whom I used to travel there with died a few years ago and I haven't been able to bring myself to go back. When I do, I will come back to the Kalyon and see you all again. Your hotel holds so many happy memories for me. Thank you, and I hope to see you soon.

Reviews.Title: “Reception Service absolutely inadequate”
Reviews.Author: Roberto22021964
Reviews.Content: I reserved and paid in advance for room, breakfast and transer from airport to hotel using the internet reservation system of the hotel. At check-out time Kalyon's receptionist asked me to pay again for transfer because, according to him, Kalyon had charged my credit card only for room and breakfast and not for airport tranfer. Fortunately I had in my pocket their internet receipt, where all services were charged on my credit card, but however I had to speak with two different receptionists (because each one continued to ask for new payment) and finally with an older man (owner? manager?) who, after a long check and several calculations confirmed my payment in advance. About 30 minutes of controversy. Very inadequate for a supposed four stars hotel. For peaople who want to reserve here, I suggest to keep receipt, because Reception Service is completely inadequate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice inside; blah outside; leaving out the backdoor is a pain”
Reviews.Author: Naveedb
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about the hotel Pros - Clean, comfortable, and updated interior - By the waterfront (but on a very busy street) - Great for business traveller, not so much for leisure travellers - Conceirge gals (Batul and the other two) were amazing - they really spent a lot of time with us figuring out how to do the things we wanted to do (Thanks!) Cons - Location was a little farther away from all the sites and you had to walk through some darker, lonlier, smaller streets to get to the hotel - Leaving and arriving at the back door was a lot closer to the main sights but was a pain in the you know what. Someone had to come and open the door for you after you rang the bell. Sometimes it was a short while and other times it took a few! - Street noise was very loud - you could hear loud noises and music till pretty late - A bit pricy - you can find something in the same or lesser price range, farther up the hill, closer to the sights, and with more charm (Kalyon had none) - Internet (Wifi) was very choppy - I expect better from a business looking hotel If I were going on business, I may stay there but for Leisure, I would likely stay at one of the others that have a little more charm.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, satisfying stay”
Reviews.Author: WanderingstarMumbai
Reviews.Content: The kalyon hotel in istanbul is located in a strategic location overlooking the beautiful blue sea. Added to which it is just a ten-minute walk to the main area of the city where Grand Bazaar and the spice market are located. Furthermore just about 400 meters away is an interesting local restaurant frequented by a very decent local people.( Only problem is if you a a little late it gets really full at mealtimes and the waiters there start getting stressed seeing foreigners lining up.) But coming back to the Kalyon - it has a beautiful terrace on the ground floor where breakfast is laid out and you can sit in your free time nursing a drink and enjoying the view and atmosphere. Breakfast is good, the waitresses check regularly for coffee and tea refills. They serve with a smile and are pleasant. Can't say the same for the waiters though who seemed a bit surly. A senior manager oversees it all with his fastidious eye making sure all guests are happy. Housekeeping is prompt and it is very clean. The people at reception however seem sometimes a bit stressed and slow. The reception area though is spacious with enough sofas for you to wait for a friend or a tour guide to pick you up. All in all,this was a place we were happy to be in and had a really good stay here. Recommended to all - family and business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “It is the best”
Reviews.Author: Reema80
Reviews.Content: The location is great ,fast check in and check out .the space for room and decoration in lovely ,the stuff is kind .i missing my jacket in the hotel and they send it by express post . i will return to the hotel next holiday . note 1-the reception is missing the smile. 2-when i sleeping i cant open the window because a street is very very noisey. 3- i never use the spa and swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: nelsonjohn1
Reviews.Content: that was a great hotel.location was so good. close to old town . the staff was so helpful and friendly. if we go to istanbul again definetly will stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice seaside hotel close to Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: ALeJune
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend trip in Istanbul where we stayed at the Kalyon Hotel. The hotel is a 5 minute walk to Sultanahmet directly behind the Blue Mosque. Upon arrival at this hotel, they were unable to locate our room reservation and for the night the hotel was full. The staff were extremely apologetic and moved us to a room at a hotel directly behind the Kalyon. However due to the inconvience they upgraded our room to a suite for the duration of our stay. Although the situation was stressful the hotel staff went out of their way to ensure that we were taken care of and made sure the remainder of our stay was good. The hotel itself is very up to date and clean! It is 30 minutes away from the airport and a taxi fare to and/from the airport is only 35 Turkish Lira. I liked that the hotel was not necessarily in the heart of the tourist center, but close enough to walk to the sights! Overall a good stay and a fairly reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “Great location at decent value.”
Reviews.Author: BabaLjuba
Reviews.Content: Great location with 5 minutes walking distance to most of the old towns sights like Hagia Sofia and Topkapi, etc. Stayed in a ''delux'' room, which was decent size, had complementary water bottles every day and was kept clean. I rated it as a 4, and the only reason is that the restaurant was seriously over priced compared to what you could get out there on town.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, spacious, great breakfast and pretty close to tourist attractions.”
Reviews.Author: Vacationables
Reviews.Content: The breakfast is amazing here (for a price). The restaurant is too expensive, so we didn't eat dinner or lunch here. There are so many places to eat in Istanbul. They have no concierge which is a shame. They will only recommend you to one or two restaurants. Seems like people at the front desk don't know Istanbul at all! Walking up the hill is a bit of a drag, as it is about 15-20 min walk away from the Blue Mosque. Internet is a nuance to use, as you have to login every 5 minutes. Beds could be more comfortable. They don't have king size beds, instead we slept in 2 twin beds next to each other. Rooms were extremely clean. I think this is good for business travelers more than tourists. We stayed in a hostel after this, and while it was nothing near this hotel, we paid 1/10th the price. Yes please (you'll get this when you visit Istanbul).

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: andycott69
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel just 30 minutes from the airport. Very nice receptionists. Some aspects of the organization might be improved.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing in the heart of a very busy City”
Reviews.Author: neilrotherham
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived 7.30 from an o/night flight they were most accommodating in trying to get us an early room, this they achieved in two hours.The best rooms are over the bar/restaurant at the front with uninterrupted views of the sea. The location is superb in that it is only a 10 min. walk to the Sultanahmet. Breakfast is delightful and service attentive but not at rushed. All the staff most attentive and always smiling and it does not have the large corporate feel, Great.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Sahab_h
Reviews.Content: The hotel in general was good, rooms clean and spacious panoramic sea was fantastic and the staff most helpful and friendly but the location of the hotel was far from Sultan Ahmed, this is a problem at night when walking back to the hotel because the streets narrow and dark

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Old City visitors”
Reviews.Author: pnefidov
Reviews.Content: Seaside rooms are most suitable just not for good view (most of them are behind the fortress wall). The opposite rooms are more noisy in the early morning.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel and very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: ashleywethmann
Reviews.Content: the service is really good ,the hotel is clean, modern and all the staff is really good.

Reviews.Title: “splendid hotel in the vicinity of all major sights in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: 40years10371
Reviews.Content: We liked the hotel, staff were extremely friendly and helpful. It is 5 minutes away from the Blue mosque and Hagia Sophia and less than 10 from the Topkapi. Wonderful view onto the Marmara Sea from the Breakfast Room and most rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant but don't get ripped off”
Reviews.Author: milovance
Reviews.Content: Forget opening your windows to get the Sea air, the traffic noise is horrific. Be sure to get a good rate, because a glass of wine is a ripoff at $15 US per glass. All in all though, the Hotel is clean and comfortable and one of the most convenient.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ers_11
Reviews.Content: First, the hotel is located in a walking distance from the most important sightseeing places in Istanbul. Second, the service is really good: the hotel is clean, modern and all the staff is always willing to help you. Third, the amenities are great: an amazing breakfast and a "back door" closer to nice restaurants. Finally, the price is definitely fair to the value it offers.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tsuleman
Reviews.Content: We checked into kalyon hotel on our 2nd day in Istanbul after a bad experience in our first hotel! The room was spacious clean and neat! Wonderful view of the blue mosque walking distance for all the sights! Really polite staff and excellent service! Would definitely stay here again and will definately recommend to friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “EVERYTHING WAS PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: 189400Mike
Reviews.Content: Everything was organised very well and the staff was very friendly.I will stay again in the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Vdawar
Reviews.Content: Positives: 1) Nice Location 2) Near Blue Mosque Area 3) Nice Shopping places nearby 4) Good Staff except Desk Negatives: 1) Not very good food available. 2) Commitment Failure in Room Tariff. 3) Different rates if you book online and personally on Desk 4) Rooms availability after 12 noon only.

Reviews.Title: “Best business hotel facing the beach”
Reviews.Author: manojk9
Reviews.Content: At any hotel, we as business travelers expect a good sleep, a good shower & a good breakfast, in addition to a good location. Kalyon has all of these. Kudos ! Kalyon Hotel also has a good ambience, which makes a tired business traveler find warmth, after return from a day long work schedule or business meeting. This is the best part of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: DanielBG
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated on one of the busiest streets. The windows do not seal well and the noise of cars is awful. The elevator is very noisy too and we couldn't sleep because we were hearing it moving all night. The wireless internet isn't working. The women who did the housekeeping raid the room early in the morning and startled us. In the lobby bar one coffee was $10, very expensive! I will never go again in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: KW59
Reviews.Content: Room was very small but this was OK as I was on my own on a business trip. A couple would certainly need a bigger room than room 120. The staff were very very polite and very helpful, top marks to them. When I first arrived my room was cold and the radiator wouldn't work but this was rectified quickly. The food was very good and I enjoyed the breakfast unlike some others. It's in a great location and I I would stay again and intend to return.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: cris197590
Reviews.Content: very nice and clean. Polite people working in. Very good and confortable rooms on both sides of the hotel. fantastic view on the blue mosque on the back side

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, very close to the city centre”
Reviews.Author: chiaraMCG
Reviews.Content: Very confortable rooms, near the main tourist attractions. The service was good and all the staff was very kind and able to fulfill any need you may ask. They also offer the possibility to use Internet connection free.

Reviews.Title: “A tidy and quiet, good located hotel, with very obliging staff, who made you feel at home!”
Reviews.Author: kgrude
Reviews.Content: A friendly hotel where we had no problems to find our way around.It was clean and tidy both in the common areas and in our room. It was quiet in the hotel (perhaps not that many guests during newyear?) and we would have appreciated music in the bar in the afternoons. Though it was quiet, the room did not seem very sound isolated. The room was very tidy and clean, not big, but then we had the standard room. The bathroom was very nice, the hairdryer is not very efficient, though. The breakfast was absolutely very good, with lots to choose between and nice view to the sea, a cosy atmoshpere there too, with very helpful waiters. Also the staff in the reception was very helpful and kind. We missed a boiler/kettle to make our own tea or coffee:)

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, will consider to stay again!”
Reviews.Author: C_Diong
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for 3 nights, its atmosphere was nice, staff were all very friendly and helpful in giving ideas and guidance. Location is fantastic. About 10 mins walk to Blue Mosque. Will definitely consider to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Kaylon.”
Reviews.Author: AranMP
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Kalyon hotel was a wonderful experience. The reception staff was extremely friendly and helpful. They helped us to organize excursions, to find addresses, how to get to some places, they made phone calls for us, they asked for taxis, gave us orientation on some prices... So Congratulations to the reception staff!!! The hotel is stylish and quite new though some maintenance works are needed (room's painting for instance). The location is wonderful, close to the Blue Mosque. We found out the breakfast a bit expensive for what they served; the quality of the coffee, chocolate and cereals needs to be improved.

Reviews.Title: “very freindly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: iqbal1
Reviews.Content: at the time of booking no mention was made of room only.on the booking page below the rate was written breakfast is served between 7 and 10 am.Only after I booked and paid and received confirmation it stated ROOM ONLY.As there was no time to cancel (cancellation Fee) I had no option but to pay 24 euros p.nite xtra for breakfast which I think was unfair.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with traffic issues”
Reviews.Author: vs_1498
Reviews.Content: Excellent. Neat n clean hotel, close to all historical sights, great accessibility to historical area , but only issue is when you open windows a lot of disturbance is there due to traffic. Stayiing here for more than a week , as it is winter they have closed central air conditioning system which means if You need cool atmospere in your room you have to open windows n if u open windows full night you here traffic or Some activity going on in marmara sea, otherwise a great hotel with perfect location .

Reviews.Title: “fantastic reasonably priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: kkkjjukkjnkjnb
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the kalyon - it is in a very convenient location for all the major attractions and is surrounded by good restaurants and bars. the staff are pristine and perfectly mannered - my partner and i travel a great deal - this was a superb find - we were really impressed. thanks kalyon

Reviews.Title: “we love it”
Reviews.Author: erkink
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, fresh atmosphere, frendly and attentive stuff, optimal location for sightseeng and travelling around the city. But our room near the road, back of the hotel in the morning very high city sound.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel...I will choose it next time Im in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: DrAbdulaziz
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during my vacation in istanbul and i would say this hotel was over 5 star hotel and the staff services and cleannes were great..

Reviews.Title: “The best city in Europe”
Reviews.Author: Stirrat
Reviews.Content: Find time to explore this wonderful exciting city. this place is ever changing and there are some fantastic hidden places only a local can find for you. It's worth spending two weeks of your holiday here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for leisure”
Reviews.Author: eruzanova
Reviews.Content: We enjoied staying at the hotel. Helpful and English speaking staff. Excellent location to the famous historical places. There are a lot of restaurants near the hotel. Good Mramor sea view.

Reviews.Title: “Good location near famous mosques and palace”
Reviews.Author: 5crawfords
Reviews.Content: Although I've stayed here before and had much bigger room upgrades, this stay was equally enjoyable. There are plenty of young uniformed associates in the lobby to help you with whatever you need - arrange for a taxi, print out a map to local restaurants, let you in the back door, fix your laundry mistakes, etc. The breakfast buffet is a must. It is as large as any in Europe. I definately recommend walking out the back door, up the street, and finding excellent local restaurants for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Nosphorous under your feet”
Reviews.Author: drobuz
Reviews.Content: Greta hotel I recommemend to all I had my wife during this business travel with me and she had recservation when I booked via priceline but overall she has satisfied so much that she has cooked"BOZA" over my head until I have completed this review

Reviews.Title: “very good quality hotel very good service great Bosphorus views”
Reviews.Author: olyra2008
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel with very good service staff, isolated from the hustle of busy Sultanahmet but still right in it this hotel offers spacey, large, comfortable room. If you get a sea view room it will only raise the pleasure of your stay. The building is nothing special from the outside compare to the beautifully decorated wooded hotels a few streets up the hill but rooms are well insulated, have air condition, space and are very comfortable. Service is very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is served in a covered terrace facing the Bosphorus (some tables even outdoor for the smokers). Quality is excellent. The hotel's entrance is from highway along the coast (which causes some noise if you have a sea view room) at night but there is a back door which lets you reach the Blue Mosque and Haghia Sophia within 10 minutes. Very safe neighborhood!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive”
Reviews.Author: MikeSilva18
Reviews.Content: We travel around the World and stay in many hotels. Prior to booking via the Internet the room was 900euro for two nights. The room was discounted to 300 for the period. I would have never paid the 900e. Only a shower which was small. The room average, the bathroom yes slippers provided but no Robes, no shower gel although shampoo provided. Coffe in the room I would expect of a 4star hotel. Nice view of the sea but not worh the 900e as listed. Clean and tidy presentation Mr and Mrs Homewood

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Stambul”
Reviews.Author: djem-sedan
Reviews.Content: Very clean rooms, fresh atmosphere, frendly and attentive stuff, optimal location for sightseeng and travelling around the sity. Excellent place for jogging along Marmor sea shore/

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: martin_bis
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Kalyon Hotel for 4 nights. We received a free upgrade to a Junior Suite which was very nice! The room was very big. It was facing the road and you could hear the cars but it was not as loud as other reviewers mentioned. I heard the breakfast was overpriced ,but we did not take it and went outside in the mornings, so no need for breakfast. Location is excellent, very close to blue mosque and markets and nice little restaurants. I liked it!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy & Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: gal_tash
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 adults and 2 young children) stayed here for 5 nights. The location is perfect walking distance to many of the touristic sites & lots of little shops nearby. It also has lovely views of the water. Our kids had fun watching several boats pass by our hotel window. I would definitely recommend this hotel. The staff were friendly. Only down side was no free airport shuttle. The airport is fairly close (about 15 min drive); however, it cost us $60 Euros to take a shuttle one way. If you can manage to take a taxi, it's about $30. With the amount of luggage we had, we required a larger vehicle. The hotel was pretty quiet. The cleaning staff did an excellent job! They cleaned our room everyday and it was spotless! One day they left chocolates on our pillows and one day they left a piece of paper informing us of the weather for the following day. Great TVs in the rooms, but it went to waste because there was no channels in English (no satellite TV). Our only purpose was for our 4-year-old to watch cartoons....which he watched in Turkish language. If you don't care about TV, then it won't be an issue. Satellite would of been appreciated though since we couldn't spend much time out in the evening since the kids were sleeping. Laptop came in handy for this :)

Reviews.Title: “Exellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: svennus
Reviews.Content: I'd like to use Tripadvisor to give my compliments to the Kalyon accomodation and staff ! We had a real good time at the Kalyon , I will recommend this hotel to everyone else ! We booked 2 executive rooms but got free upgrade to junior suites due to overbooking , i think because we arrived late in the evening . Very nice and helpful english speaking staff , and very good food at the restaurant . Rooms were very clean and luxury . We certainly come back to Istanbul and the Kalyon hotel . Greetings from Holland

Reviews.Title: “Very descent hotel, walking distance to the archaelogical sites, and not far from the business center.”
Reviews.Author: NikosY
Reviews.Content: Great sea view of the Vosposous, and staff very much willing to accomodate the guests. Overall a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jujubean14
Reviews.Content: We really loved the location it was super convienent, the room had a wonderful view of the Marama sea and it was super clean..the only downfall to the hotel was the bathroom plumbing most be horrible bc if your neighbor used the restroom you can smell it and it was awful....but I still would stay there again...and the customer service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “a safe choice”
Reviews.Author: myescapes
Reviews.Content: It's difficult to find hotels in any city, and particularly so in Istanbul. We opted for this for a large group and it was perfect. All rooms more or less the same, loads with a sea view (the 'city view' rooms mostly look onto a tiny lane at back so don't expect to see mosques against the skyline). We knew from research it was on a busy dual carriageway so were prepared for some traffic noise. The upsides are: double glazing, quiet at night and the sea is the other side of the road, so lots of sky, views of boats and breathing space here, in contrast to closely packed hotels up the hill right in the old city. Superb staff, huge breakfasts, reasonable price. Would go back, especially as we passed, on our travels, many of the other hotels on which we had done extensive research; most were in noisy chaotic streets and would have had v. variable rooms which is what we wanted to avoid. This is an established Turkish run hotel and we all would recommend it. 10 mins really nice walk through interesting streets up to the mosques.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, staff very kind, nice food, clean and wifi included”
Reviews.Author: Milvus_milvus10
Reviews.Content: Nice location. Front to the sea Bosforo, nice view. 15km from/to airport, straith forward. 12 minutes walk to the blue mosq and Sophia 22 minutes walt to the grand bazaar.

Reviews.Title: “Dear Sir, I have a complain of some...”
Reviews.Author: Jamourian
Reviews.Content: Dear Sir, I have a complain of some services you offer, such as: Transportation to/from the hotel, I was waiting for a taxi, but in the end , it turned out to be that you didn't send me anything. TV channels, I wasn't able to watch all the channels since 80% of the channels were blue screen. There are no International channels such as Jazera, CNN , .... Why don't you do a small corner for a souvenir shop. Regards, Serge

Reviews.Title: “Good service!”
Reviews.Author: lrich20
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kalyon hotel as we were attending a wedding at the hotel next door. The Service was excellent! All staff were very attentive. Rooms were of a good quality - although the bed sheets were very hard which is why I put a three for sleep quality ( hope that doesn't sound too pathetic!) The location was excellent and we could see the Blue Mosque from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, helpful management and staff”
Reviews.Author: mumbergen
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to Istanbul.We stayed at Kaylon hotel and enjoyed our stay there very much. Before going, I checked TripAdvisor to find out what to expect and to my disappointment I read that the beds were very hard. But when I found out that it was possible to get a thin and soft madrass to put on top of the hard one, I was really looking forward to our stay. We found Kaylon hotel to our liking; the location was fine, in walking distance of almost everything, the breakfast buffet was varied, the staff helpful and polite. Imagening waking up to the sight of the Blue Mosque just outside the window and eating breakfast outside, watching the boats cruising the Marmara sea. My advice to future guests would be to contact the hotel prior to your arrival if you as we do, like softer beds. The management helped us with all our requests. If we were to go to Istanbul again, we would not hesitate to stay at Kaylon hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “High expectations - Poor Results”
Reviews.Author: Natalie-PRT
Reviews.Content: I thought that this hotel would be 5 star considering the price of the room but sadly I was disappointed. The staff were very friendly but when our air conditioner started leaking late the last night of our stay, they did very little to notify us about the problem or provide us with a discount for what ended up being an uncomfortable night's sleep. The hotel is in a great location near the water in Sultanemet but there are dozens of hotels that are closer to the tourist hot spots, more charming and better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: SamboUAE
Reviews.Content: Kalyon hotel has an amazing view of the Sea of Marmara, and is perfectly located on the JFK highway that runs to the main international airport. It's at the foot of the hill where the Blue Mosque and Haja Sophia are located, so the walk up is a quick 8 mins stroll through the old town of Istanbul. The staff was very friendly and addressed every concern raised (room type, internet service, pillow/bed service). The room was clean and functional, with amazing views of the sea. The one downside was the bed - it's a bit short and the linens used were not the most comfy. Also, be sure to ask for a mattress sponge to be added to your bed - otherwise, it's a tough sleep. The breakfast is hearty and diverse. I didn't try the restaurant for lunch or dinner, but the menu is limited to western-type dishes. Near the hotel are pleny of options, so this isn't an issue. I will definitely stay at Kalyon again when I visit for business.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent holiday in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: shaden09_10
Reviews.Content: First i would like to thank all the staff in Kalyon hotel, they were very friendly and helpful during our stay. The hotel has a great location; it was easy to reach all the attraction in sultanahmed old city and has a great sea view,the breafast in the hotel was very good and the dinner was excellent and romantic.i have been in many hotels befor but this was the best holiday I ever had

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel ,lovely location ,best...”
Reviews.Author: akbarrian
Reviews.Content: Great hotel ,lovely location ,best service but too many staff constantly looking over to be helpful (may be to helpful ). I will be returning time and time to your hotel and hope you can understand my constructive criticisms. Dr Akbareian 00447710493494.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel by the road”
Reviews.Author: Ipanemagirl10
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and staff. Quite difficult to find the location if you arrive by public transportation. Breakfast and restaurant are too expensible for the offering.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: CostinP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel Kalyon during the U2 concert in Istanbul. The standard room that we chose was very clean but also very small and the bed was too short (we slept with our feet hanging out - we are average hight). The bathroom ventilation was inadequate there was a moisty smell in the room every evening. The breakfast was good and there is a nice view of the sea from the restaurant terrace. We got a little upset with the staff because they wouldn't allow our friend, who was not staying in the hotel, to come up an visit us in the room - Hotel security policy they say. Kalyon has uses an expensive shuttle service that will charge you 50 euro to and from the airport for 2 people. The taxi costs about 17 euro..... This hotel's best asset is its location - 5 min walk to Sultanahmet through very picturesque alleys with beautifully renovated old buildings.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel offering value for money”
Reviews.Author: minico
Reviews.Content: Our group of 2 couples, had a 7 days stay at the KALYON hotel and we had wonderful time. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel was extremely clean and the food was just fabulous and very tasteful. In a nutshell value for money. I will certainly visit again KALYON, if I travel again to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - great staff”
Reviews.Author: rk1400
Reviews.Content: We loved the Kalyon hotel. It was spotlessly clean and well appointed. The staff were incredibly friendly and very helpful - the service was absolutely excellent. We enjoyed the breakfasts on the terrace anddinner was also very good. We were a little surprised by how quiet things wre in the evenings but this may be accounted for by Ramadan. Only one complaint - and that is not about the hotel itself: I was travelling with my Mum so the poor walking conditions into the centre were a bit of a problem but we appreciate nothing which is in the control of the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: JUANGARCIAHERCE
Reviews.Content: At 2.00 in the morning somebody from a close room was doing too much noise, and we had to call to reception more than twice. Also some frineds that we have close to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Great service in a great location”
Reviews.Author: chas03
Reviews.Content: Close to airport and ideal for the main sights.but the main this was the service and the welcome. Nothing was too much trouble and we all had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with excellent staff who...”
Reviews.Author: Vessi7
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with excellent staff who couldn't have been more helpful! Thanx for a very enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent Location and Excellent views”
Reviews.Author: Michele041
Reviews.Content: Would recommend Sea View Room, staff very pleasant and helpful, spotless hotel, executive rooms good size, restaurant & Breakfast excellent. Have stayed in number of hotels in Istanbul and would definitely book Kalyon on next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Feeling at home”
Reviews.Author: leeward_de
Reviews.Content: Very clean, excellent position, restaurant and food of best quality at accessible prices, very professional service

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: lara091
Reviews.Content: i chose this hotel from the reviews i always do that and i was lucky ecxept for this one ! the hotel is 4 stars but has nothing to do with it. i chose the classic room at first but when i went there the room was like a cell overlooking an ugly old building. i tried to cancel my booking but i was going to be charged anyways for 1 night so i choose to stay and to upgrade to the grand classic room it was spacious with a great view but the air condition was barely working , we could hear a baby screaming in the next room also the bed was very hard not comfortable at all.even the reception when i was checking in i was feeling terribly hot even though the AC was on .the hotel has no swimming pools and no beach it only overlooks the sea

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and good base for exploring Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: dakics
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days in Kalyon Hotel, with very good rate for almost last-minute booking. Staff and service were super friendly and responsive. Location is perfect, within walking distance of the Sultanahmet area and easily accessible by car, once you get used to Istanbul traffic (GPS is a must for first time visitor!). We did not have room with the sea-view but the terrace in the evening is just as good. We were not impressed by the bathroom which is barely 3* standard, but maybe it was just a wrong room (you can see that hotel has been renovated recently). Mosaic cafe is overpriced - you can find better value and more interesting environment just minutes up the hill.

Reviews.Title: “excellent to everything”
Reviews.Author: panos37
Reviews.Content: If the breakfast was included in the price,everything would be just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “convenient place”
Reviews.Author: deniseWien
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for good value for money, this is a good choice of hotel. The loaction is very convenient and the rooms are rel. newly furnished and clean. It is not very quiet as the big street runs in front of the rooms and the isolation is not the best. But it doesn't disturb too much. Overall we had a very good experience there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place for Sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Atul_Dubai
Reviews.Content: It is a nice place to stay if you want to stay on the walking distance to major sights. Nice Clean rooms, very efficient staff be it either FO, Valet, Bell Boys, F&B or Houskeeping. Rooms are a bit smaller but with a great view (Superior). I would definitly recommend to stay there

Reviews.Title: “kuwait”
Reviews.Author: ku76uk
Reviews.Content: Everything Excellent Except the Internet was limited 1- the TV chanels was limited with only three English speaking channels, the rest were all turkish. 2- they don't have Airport transfer service to and from Sabiha Gokcen Airport

Reviews.Title: “Memorable and enjoyable stay at Kalyon , Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: mhbw
Reviews.Content: The hotel services were excellent. Allowed me early check-in at about 8 am . Helped me to arrange for a Dinner Cruise and Bursa Trip . Showed me the direction to Blue Mosque and other places. The room was clean and neat.

Reviews.Title: “TOO MUCH NOISE (BIG road between room and sea !)”
Reviews.Author: VivieParis
Reviews.Content: Really too much noise (cars, taxis, etc.) It is better to go to hotels not exactly on the sea. The view is the same, but without the terrible noise. And you can't cross easyly this horrible road where cars go very fastly...

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring Old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: RashAnna
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed by the location of the hotel, with its lush garden facing the Bay of Marmara, and majestic view of the Blue mosque from our window. We arrived fairly early in the morning, long before check-in time, but our room was made available without too much delay, and we were treated to Turkish tea/coffee while we waited. The staff was extremely helpful and hospitable.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel super location lovely staff = beautiful holiday”
Reviews.Author: gaupai
Reviews.Content: stayed for 4 nights at the kalyon hotel in istanbul. the hotel impresses you right from when you enter as the friendly staff check you in and show you to the room/s we were right in the middle of all you would like to see in istanbul..we walked to the blue mosque, hagia sophia, grand bazaar topkapi palace all within ten minutes from the hotel. the rooms and breakfast were great and the views of the marmara sea were stunning. one night our infant hurt his hand and the doctor was called,the staff were great again and though the doctor took some time eventually resolved our issues . Sarah at reservations and Ali at reception particularly were very helpful i would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting istanbul. the only grouse i would have if any was that there was no pool,but with a city like istanbul with so many thing s to see in such a short time,it was no big deal. a lovely hotel right in the middle of it all but still nestled quietly away!

Reviews.Title: “You feel very welcome, very important and very very...good!”
Reviews.Author: Memis1982
Reviews.Content: Hallo to all! While I was in Istanbul, my company has booked for me at first three days, then extended it to four days. So four days in Istanbul...four days at Kalyon! At my first entrnce of this hotel I could see it belongs to the turkisch modern and historic culture. It has got an uncompareabel flair, also beause of its location. Weh you leave it you can see the other side of Istanbul und this fantzastic see. You can go for a walk hours and hours and at the end you will forget the time but not your space. It took only a few minutes to reach the great, and I mean great, Sultan Ahmet Mosque and the Hagia Sophia. Kalyon Hotel has a very central location from where you can reach the railway system in Istanbuk, which is very comfortable und cheap. And when you come back to your hotel, the Kalyon team will welcome you again, like it is your first visit...with a warm and helpful smile. After your first night and your great sleep, take a shower and go downstairs to the bright und luxury dining room to get your tasteful breakfast, which can be turkish or also european. It is up to you, but one thing is sure; you will enjoy. And I think that a day with a perfekt breakfast will be a perfekt day, so you will always have a great day...in Kalyon Hotel Istanbul! I swear! Memis

Reviews.Title: “Prime location, beautiful view!”
Reviews.Author: DianaFilistine
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Kalyon for a week in June 2010. From the minute that I was picked up from the airport by the car service that the Kalyon provided until I was dropped back off at the airport a week later, I was satisfied. I booked two sea view rooms and was so pleased by cleanliness and the view of the Marmara Sea that I had from both rooms. The Old City of Sultanahmet is a short, easy 5 minute walk from the back door of the hotel, with restaurants, cafes and small shops lining the streets on the way up. Late at night there are night guards that are lining the back street, and there is always a greeter in the front of the hotel. I don't speak Turkish and I am a young female but I felt completely safe in and around our hotel day and night. The staff of the hotel provided us with impeccable service and we were always greeted with a smile. The day before I flew in to Istanbul, I received an email telling me that my hotel reservation was cancelled, I called the hotel and they worked the issue out immediately. I had no issues with anything at this hotel. Food in the onsite restaurant is expensive, but a short walk out the front of the hotel to the left or to the right will bring you to restaurants that are open from about 8 am until about 1030 pm, after 1030 pm, the Armada hotel serves light sandwiches until midnight, but for the best food in the city, it is definitely worth the walk up to Sultanahmet. Each morning, the maid service will leave the weather report on your pillow as well as a signed card from the maid asking you to contact her if there are any issues. Internet access is controlled via your room and passport numbers, and it is free and unlimited for the entirety of your stay. The hotel is clean, well appointed, and in a perfect location, the staff is fantastic, and the price is right. The Kalyon Hotel is one that I will definitely be staying at again when I return to Istanbul. If you have any further questions about details of my stay, feel free to email me at ein_il_qamar@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Solid Business Hotel with Great Views of the Water”
Reviews.Author: travelquest55
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after reading positive reviews on Tripadvisor and because I needed good Wifi access. I wasn't looking for some boutique hotel with quirky owners but a good business hotel. I wasn't disappointed, the hotel is situated on the esplanade with great views over the road of the passing ships - making for enjoyable breakfast buffets and evening drinks. The rooms were clean and simple, in-room dining menu was also simple and safe. Wifi worked everywhere so everyone had a good internet connection and staff were pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Kalyon is worth to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Dilber_10
Reviews.Content: Finally it is my turn to write a review about Kalyon Hotel in Istanbul. Let me first mention that I have read a lot of reviews in booking.com and in tripadvisor about many hotels before my travel. I had couple of hotels in my list to choose and Kalyon was one of them. I was not sure that Kalyon would really proof my expectation. Now about the hotel. it is near to airport located in old city, near Sultanahmet mosque, Topkapi palace, Al-Sofia and other historic places about 5 min walk. Breakfast is super with wonderful view to the Marmara sea. You can see dolphines swimming in the sea in the morning, while having your breakfast. Rooms are newly refurbished , clean, no carpet on floor. LCD TV monitor. Generally i would rate it good +. You may order one of 3 types pillows free of charge to your room, they are feather, ortopdeic and hard ortopedic. In rooms and in the hotel wi-fi free of charge. I recommend this hotel to everyone and if i come to Istanbul ever again, i will choose this hotel. Apart from center Taksim square, this place is very quite. I also recommend "Mesale" restorant which is near Sultanahmet. The restorant has a very good menu and life music and "dervish"( men in white clothes) dansing. Staff is very welcome and friendly. I will attach photos soon.

Reviews.Title: “Spettacolo”
Reviews.Author: enrica75
Reviews.Content: It was a very nice, modern clean and roomy place, with one of the best restaurants in town...but almost hidden, right by the water. Gorgeous!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: YasminaJohannesburg
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at Kalyon for three nights. The staff were superb and so was the service. We had a room (right at the end of the long corridor) but it faced the Marmara Sea. The view at lovely, but be warned that the traffic on the road in front of the hotel is busy 24 hours! I had two minor complaints, one that the lighting was very bad in the rooms so that reading was almost impossible. The beds were a ittle to hard. We had no mini bar fridge in our room although we booked a superior se-facing room. I would suggest that the hotel consider tea and coffee making facilities for the rooms. Providing drinking water would also be a good idea. Walking back to the hotel from the back entrance can be very quiet late at night. Taxi drivers complain about the traffic to and from the hotel in the Old City. It was quicker to walk even from the Grand Bazaar!

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel for holiday or business trip. Fantastic location for main sights.”
Reviews.Author: m4ngo
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel for our first trip to Istanbul - only a 5 min walk to the main sights:aya Sofia, blue mosque and topkapi palace. Rooms were very modern, clean and spacious. Food in thr restaurant was of a good standard and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “A superb, smart hotel, with staff who are attentive and extremely helpful - if only UK service could be like this!”
Reviews.Author: Barebum
Reviews.Content: Thank you Tripadvisor - for information on this hotel for my Easter weekend in Istanbul. My husband and I think that this was the very best choice for luxury without the large price ticket. I was delighted to find this hotel was newly refurbished in a very modern way, which was a pleasing juxtaposition with the rather higgledy-piggledy jumble sale of buildings around it - Istanbul is a strange mixture of the beautiful cheek by jowl with the derelict! But the real reasons that I wanted to write about this hotel are as follows: as we stepped into the lobby the front of house staff addressed us by name (!) and had all our room keys ready to go. Our bags were moved everywhere for us. I am not lazy; I am not accustomed to being waited on hand a foot, but it was very welcome late on a Saturday night after a day of travelling. Look at the photos to see that the Standard rooms are excellent and are worth turning down a sea view for. Think about it- you will only admire the view briefly twice a day at most if you have come to see Istanbul. The room service was extremely good value for money. One evening we decided to stay in and watch BBC on the TV with well cooked Turkish fare rather than run the gauntlet of being hassled by over-eager waiters outside every restaurant. Only a short walk from the Blue Mosque and the Haghia Sofia I really think we pulled a blinder with this hotel - I spoke with other European travellers, who were in small and poky hotels in streets where some of the buildings are collapsing. Just a point to note, tea and coffee nis not available in the room; however, the minibar is very good! This hotel is used by the Turks for their business and leisure trips and I can see why. Well Done Kalyon.

Reviews.Title: “A Classic Hotel with a taste of business pleasure”
Reviews.Author: manojk9
Reviews.Content: A location opposite to the sea-side, this hotel offers a very apt stay when you are back tired after a day long business. The staff has a very warm welcome attitude, to which is an added cozy atmosphere of the hotel amenities. Certainly, a good stay !

Reviews.Title: “solid business hotel”
Reviews.Author: gravitycollapse
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for four nights. Chose the hotel because I needed a place I could do some work while traveling, and for that purpose, it served me very well. Wifi was included in the price, and was hotel-wide, not only in public areas...so many hotels advertise wifi in the rooms, but it doesn't work, or barely works. Hotel was simple and clean. Not luxurious, but for a traveler on a mid-range budget it will do nicely. Staff was courteous, and though I didn't demand much from them, they courteously and thoughtfully responded to my questions . Location was good but slightly frustrating; very close to Sultanahmet, but down on the sea, meaning you have to walk out and around, and then up the hill to some of the tourist sights. I had a room with a sea view, but actually wish I had paid less for a room overlooking the back alley, because the road between the hotel and the sea is rather busy. It is not particularly convenient to trams; it's a good hotel for someone who likes to get around by taxi, but when I return to Istanbul, I'll probably choose a place closer to a tram stop so I can more easily navigate the city on foot.

Reviews.Title: “priceless View , Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: roadrunner82
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Kalyon for 5 nights in a business trip in April 09 the location is simply magnificent with a wonderful view of the sea , few minutes away from topkaby palace , I liked the urban newly furnished lobby, the rooms were very cleaned and tidy although I wasnâ€™t very lucky and I ended in aground Flore room . The staff were very helpful and cooperative most of them speaks very good English , they were kind an nice all the time , the restaurant was good , having breakfast with sea of Marmara view was priceless . For business traveler who doesnâ€™t have much time, I was planning to return to Kalyou on a vacation but unfortunately when I went back to Istanbul last November the Kalyon was fully booked Regardless of some minor issues I give Kalyon 8-9 on a scale from 1 to 10 Recommended for Honey moons, romantic vacations and couples of all ages .

Reviews.Title: “Ok business hotel with hard beds”
Reviews.Author: Coffe_N
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Kanyon hotel for three nights in October 2009 and paid 92 Euros per night inclusive of breakfast. The hotel is located in the Sultanahmet area where many of the tourist attractions are but from the hotel there are some quite steep roads leading up to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. There are several bars, restaurants, and minimarkets close to the hotel so you will not have to go without food and drink. If you take the regular train, there is a stop, Cankurtaran, almost next to the hotel. But altogether the location is so-so, especially when considering there is a big road just outside the hotel and traffic in Istanbul is noisy. The hotel seems to be very business-oriented so the staff is somewhat â€œcoldâ€� but very polite. Checking in was quite fast and I got a room on the 2nd floor facing the street. The room was fairly big but somewhat worn and the bathroom was not in that great shape with some visible stains and a crack in the sink. But altogether an OK experience EXCEPT for the bed which was hard as a rock! And I am not just saying hard â€“ I mean HARD and my colleague in another room was of the exact same opinion. Internet was for free and there was some problems logging on but a trip to the reception provided me with a user name and password. There were some problems with internet, especially late in the evening when I just didnâ€™t manage to use the internet. Breakfast was OK though annoying things as staff not letting you pour your own coffee and so did occur. The hotel was a fair value but compared to the other 4-star hotel I stayed at (Marmara Sisli), the Marmara was far better. I honestly think you can find better hotels in Istanbul for this money and the bed almost killed my back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice position and good for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: Swissgreen
Reviews.Content: Recently renewed, this hotel built in the 60s lies along the seafront, just below the Blue Mosque and the Old city. It is well organized for business travellers, although the business centre is small, but inadequate for a holiday. There are nice rooms, although I stayed in one of the tiny backrooms. The overall standard is good, but it can improve. My room stank of stale cigarette smoke which did not go away during the 3 nights I slept there. The AC was too powerful for the small room (temp. regulation not available) and I could not open the windows because of the mosquitos. No green tea available for breakfast. Extremely depressing pictures in the atrium. Just to name a few dislikes. As for the rest, the personnel was very friendly and whoever was not friendly showed to be competent. Beware, the water in Istanbul is extremely hard, so bring your hair conditioner if you have long hair, as the hotel does not provide it. Much appreciated the choice of different types of pillows and very comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely sea view. Great location. Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Juliet610
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from 6 day trip for my partner's birthday surprise. The executive, sea-view room was just as pictured on the website and lovely to sit and watch the ships passing. The hotel is not the prettiest on first sight but was very clean and nicely laid out inside. The staff were very friendly and helpful which is the most important thing. They gave us a selection of leaflets for local restaurants and trips and were happy to book trips for us. They even gave a leaflet for suggested taxi fares to the major sites and seemed concerned that people were getting ripped off by taxi drivers. The room was cleaned well each day although we didn't always get a refill of creamer or tea bags - strangely packets of salt appeared! The hotel is perfectly located for the old town although the 10 minute or so walk is uphill so maybe not suitable for everybody. The restaurant is also very good as was the room service. Also free Internet access was useful for airline check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, but needs refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: youhavetolovechicago
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a wonderful location near the water. There were other hotels, but one thing I learned about Istanbul is that squalor can be right next door to luxury so as a single woman travelling alone, I had to be cautious late at night. Having a hotel near the water allowed me to enjoy myself by the water and bridge without feeling compromised as I also don't speak the language. The rooms are an excellent size but refurbishment is long overdue, although the lobby, and dining rooms are spotless. Dining does not have a small buffet price so if you don't eat a lot in the morning, it is a big waste of money. I forgot my blackberry charger and the front desk was nice enough to charge it up for me and also schedule taxis for late dinner at a couple of excellent restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “cleanless to the max”
Reviews.Author: marotathens
Reviews.Content: A high quality hotel in good price is the first thing to be mentioned. I booked through the hotel's web site where I was please to receive quick responses and information about the booking. During my stay what satisfy me most were the sea view from my window room, the power of hot water in the shower, the cleanless of everything and the safe free of charge parking area. What I didn t like was their capuccino and the not so warm room in the nights were the degrees outside were close to 0 Celsius. Although I will pick again this really lovely and ambiental hotel in my next visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location”
Reviews.Author: happywanderer51
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days/nights at the Kalyon Hotel, and although I could not find a lot of information about it, I had a recommendation from a family friend. The location of the Hotel is wonderful and in close walking distance to all the attractions. The views from most of the rooms are great, and it was lovely just to sit in the room and loko at the Sea and the passing ships, they never stop. The rooms are not large, and the bathrooms could do with a renovation, I think some of the rooms do have new bathrooms, but not the ones we were in, The restaurant was a very good standard and we enjoyed the meals we had at the Hotel. There are a lot of other restaurants close by to choose from also. To see Istanbul you must be prepared to walk, and the Hotel is so conveniently located, it is an interesting walk to so many of the local attractions. If there is one thing I can say against the Hotel, we found the rooms to be very hot, and after complaining about the heat we were moved to another room, and even our second room was hot, but we could at least adjust the heating, but it did not seem to make a lot of difference.

HotelInfo.Name: Kalyon Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Sahil Yolu 34 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34122, Turkey
